result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayvale T Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and surcharges.  To be paid from monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision,.  Failure to pay amounts in ful would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
**Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any weapons ever.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trayvale T Henry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (22 pages) commencing JULY 15, 2015 received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Trayvale T Henry not in court, in custody.  
James Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant was not produced from the House of Correction for todays proceedings; adjourned date selected.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point caseworker verified that defendant is in custody at MSDF on a possible probation violation.  Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 7/02/15 at 8:30 a.m.
Case converted to scheduling conference; defense counsel indicated his client is in custody.  Case remains calendared for 6/10/15 at 8:30 a.m. for scheduling.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, dated 4/10/15, received and filed.

Defendant Trayvale T Henry in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defendant sworn as to testimony given.

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any weapons ever.

Defense request for an adjourned sentencing date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-10-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Trayvale T Henry in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared on behalf of Lucy Kronforst for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Trayvale T Henry in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/11/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Ericka R.; Terrell
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Trayvale T Henry in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  
Defendant Trayvale T Henry in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
